creditline: Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr.
signed: Signed in blue, lower left: Th Robinson

makers.displaydate: 1852–1896; born Irasburg, VT; died New York, NY
makers.displaymaker: Theodore Robinson, 1852–1896; born Irasburg, VT; died New York, NY

texts.textentryhtml:
Hugo Reisinger (1856-1914), by 1911; [Reisinger estate auction, New York (NY), January 18, 1916, n. 9 [1]]; purchased by D. Charles at the above sale. [Kende Galleries, New York (NY), “Reisinger et al., Furniture and Decorations”, sale no. 20, January 16-17, 1941, lot no. 117 [2]]; purchased by Frank Jewett Mather Jr. (1868-1953) at the above sale; donated to the Princeton University Art Museum, 1943.

[1] See Theodore Robinson, Bev Harrington, and William Kloss, The Figural Images of Theodore Robinson: American Impressionist, Oshkosh (WI) 1987.
[2] According to a receipt in the museum files.
